gurmukhi: jwn quPMg Brq ipckwrI sUrn AMg lgwvq ] inksq sRox AiDk Cib aupjq kysr jwn suhwvq ]
transliteration: Jaan Touphan Bharat Pichkaarisooran An Lagadvat|| Niksat Sron Adhik Chhab(i) Oupjat Kesar Jaan Suhaavat||
translation: The arrows were inflicted on the limbs of the warriors like the syringes; with the flowing out of blood, the beauty of the fighters increased as if they had splashed saffron on their limbs;

gurmukhi: sRoxq BrI jtw Aiq soBq Cbih n jwq khXo ] mwnhu prm pRym sO fwrXo eINgr lwig rhXo ]
transliteration: Sronat Bharijataa At(i) Sobhat Chhabah(i) Na Jaat Kahyo|| Maanoh Param Prem Sau Daryo|| Eengad Laag(i) Rahyo||
translation: The glory of the matted locks saturated with blood is indescribable; it appeared that with great love, the gulal was splashed in them;

gurmukhi: jh qh igrq Bey nwnw ibiD swNgn S`qR proey ] jwnuk Kyl Dmwr pswr kY AiDk sRimq h√çY soey ]118]
transliteration: Jah Tah Girat Bhae Naanaa Bidh(i) Saanad Shattra Daroe|| Jaanouk Khel Dhamaar Pasaar Kai Adhik Sramit Hvai Soe||118||
translation: The enemies stringed with lances were lying hither and thither as if they had been sleeping after the tiring play of Holi.118.

gurmukhi: ds sY brK rwj iqn kInw ] kY kY dUr d`q ky mq khu rwj jog doaU lInw ]
transliteration: Das Sai Barakh Raaj Tin Keedaa|| Kai Kai Door Datt Ke Mat Kauh Raaj Jog Dooo Leenaa||
translation: In this way, Parasnath ruled for one thousand years and ending the sect of Dutt, he extended his Rajayoga;

gurmukhi: jy jy Cpy luky khU bwcy rih rih vhY gey ] AYsy eyk nwm lYby ko jg mo rhq Bey ]
transliteration: Je Je Chhape Louke Kahoo Baache Rah(i) Rah(i) Vahai Gad|| Aise Ek Naam Laibe Ko Jag Mo Rahat Bhae||
translation: He, who his himself, remained a follower of Dutt and lived without recognition;

gurmukhi: BwNq BwNq so rwj krq XO BwNq BwNq Dn jorXo ] jhwN qhwN mwns sRaunn sun qhwN qhwN qy qorXo ]
transliteration: Bhaant Bhaant So Raaj Karat Yau Bhaant Bhaant Dhan Joryo|| Jahaan Tahaan Maanas Sraounan Soun Tahaan Tahaan Te Toryo||
translation: Ruling in various ways, the king gathered wealth by various means and wherever the came on know of it, he looted it;

gurmukhi: ieh ibiD jIq dys pur dysn jIq inSwn bjwXo ] Awpn krx kwrx kir mwnXo kwl purK ibsrwXo ]119]
transliteration: Eh Bidh(i) Jeet Des Pur Desan Jeet Nishaan Bajaayo|| Aapan Karan Kaaran Kar(i) Maanyo Kaal Purakh Bisraayo||119||
translation: In this way, conquering many countries far and near, the king extended his fame and himself forgetting the Lord began to consider himself the creator.119.

gurmukhi: ds shMsR pRmwx brK su kIn rwj suDwr ] BwNq BwNq Drwn lY Aru s`qR srb sMGwr ]
transliteration: Das Sahansra Pramaan Barakh Su Keen Raaj Sudhaar|| Bhaant Bhaant Dharaan Lai Ar(u) Sattra Sarab Sanhaar||
translation: In this way, getting onwards, killing all the enemies, conquering the earth in various ways, the king ruled for ten thousand years;

gurmukhi: jIq jIq AnUp BUp AnUp rUp Apwr ] BUp myD TtXo niRpoqm eyk jg suDwr ]120]
transliteration: Jeet Jeet Anoop Bhoop Anoop Roop Apaar|| Bhoop Medh Thatyo Nripotam Ek Jag Sudhaar||120||
translation: Conquering many kings, the king thought of performing the Raajmedh Yajna.120.

gurmukhi: dys dysn ky nrySn bwNiD kY iek bwr ] roh dys ibKY gXo lY pu`qR im`qR kumwr ]
transliteration: Des Desan Ke Dareshan Baandh(i) Kai Ik Baar|| Roh Des Bikhai Gado Lai Pouttra Mittra Koumaar||
translation: The king alongwith his sons and friends brought the kings of various countries to his own country in fetters,

gurmukhi: nwr sMjuq bYT ibDvq kIn j`g ArMB ] bol bol kror irqj AOr ib`p AsMB ]121]
transliteration: Naar Sanjout Baith Bidhvat Keen Jagg Aranbh|| Bol Bol Daror Ritaj Aur Bipp Asanbh||121||
translation: And began to perform Yajna with his wife; he also invited crores of Brahmins.121.
